$DIR.text:
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*                       RACFROD - REXX Programs                       *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*

  Member                           Description
 --------  -----------------------------------------------------------
 $DIR      This member
 RACFROD   The main REXX exec to process the main panel and skeletons
 RACFRODN  EDIT macro to display informational text to exit ISPF EDIT
 RACFRODO  Prior version of RACFROD
 RACFRODS  REXX site customization settings
 RACFRODT  REXX routine to load the ISPF Table with the avilable Reports
 STUB      REXX routine to put into a common SYSEXEC library to invoke
           RACFROD (needs customization)

RACFROD.text:
/* Rexx Dialog to Submit a Suite of Generic RACF Reports             */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
/*                                                                   */
/* Updated, 20Mar20, Lionel B. Dyck                                  */
/* . Add non-ICETOOL reports (DSMON)                                 */
/* . Change from static table to dynamic                             */
/* . Allow multiple reports to be selected                           */
/* . Add ONLY to filter and Refresh to rebuild the table             */
/* . Call site customization exec RACFRODS                           */
/*                                                                   */
/* Updated, 22Jan20, William J. Smith, Trident Services, Inc.        */
/* . Corrected return code error display in two error messages.      */
/*                                                                   */
/* Created, 03Dec19, William J. Smith, Trident Services, Inc.        */
/* . An ISPF dialog that uses file tailoring to generate 13 generic  */
/*   RACF reports using DFSort ICETOOL                               */
/* . Requires the name of the RACF unload data base (IRRUDB00)       */
/*   offload utility output                                          */
/* . The name of the file tailoring skeleton is specified below as   */
/*   an operand of the CALL to the Build_JCL inline procedure.       */
/* . The format of the job statement used below is installation      */
/*   specific.  Modify as needed.                                    */
/*                                                                   */
/* The hard-coded name of the file tailoring skeleton is RACFREPT.   */
/*                                                                   */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */

/* Trace ?I                                                          */

  Address ISPEXEC
  "CONTROL ERRORS CANCEL"

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
/*                                                                   */
/* JOB Statement Construction                                        */
/*                                                                   */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */

  "VGET (ZACCTNUM, ZTEMPF) ASIS"

/* --------------- *
 | Define defaults |
 * --------------- */
  parse value '' with null
  rrdalarm = "YES"
  rrdtyp = "NOTIFY"

  syspref = sysvar("syspref")
  sysuid  = sysvar("sysuid")
  acct    = zacctnum

  If syspref = null then
  syspref = sysuid

  jname = sysuid
  if length(jname) < 8 then jname = jname'R'

  'vget (rrjc1 rrjc2 rrjc3 rrjc4) profile'

  jc_update = 0

  if rrjc1 = null then do
    rrjc1 = ,
      "//"left(jname,8)" JOB ("acct"),'RACF ReportsOnDemand',CLASS=A,"
      jc_update = 1
  end

  if rrjc2 = null then
  rrjc2 = ,
    "//     MSGLEVEL=(1,1),NOTIFY=&SYSUID,REGION=0M"

  if rrjc3 = null then
  rrjc3 = ,
    "/*JOBPARM L=999999"

  if rrjc4 = null then
  rrjc4 = ,
    "//OUT    OUTPUT DEFAULT=YES,JESDS=ALL,OUTDISP=(HOLD,HOLD)"

  if jc_update = 1 then do
    zcmd = null
    jc1 =  rrjc1
    jc2 =  rrjc2
    jc3 =  rrjc3
    jc4 =  rrjc4
    'display panel(racfrods)'
    if rc = 0 then do
      rrjc1 = jc1
      rrjc2 = jc2
      rrjc3 = jc3
      rrjc4 = jc4
     'vput (rrjc1 rrjc2 rrjc3 rrjc4) profile'
    end
  end


/* --------------------------------- *
 | Create the RACF ISPF Report Table |
 * --------------------------------- */
  ratab = racfrodt()

/* ----------------------- *
 | Get site customizations |
 * ----------------------- */
  x = racfrods()
  'vget (rsub) profile'

/* ---------------------------------------- *
 | Selected flag indicates reports selected |
 * ---------------------------------------- */
  selected = 0

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
/*                                                                   */
/* Display RACFROD - RACF Reports On-Demand Selection Panel          */
/*                                                                   */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */

  rtop = 1

  do forever
    parse value '' with rsel doit
    if ztdsels > 1 then 'tbdispl' ratab
    else do
      'tbtop' ratab
      'tbskip' ratab 'number('rtop')'
      'tbdispl' ratab 'panel(racfrodt)'
    end
    display_rc = RC
    'vput (rsub) profile'
    If display_rc > 4 then if row = 0 then
    Do
      if selected > 0 then leave
      rrdsm = "RACF ROD display ended"
      rrdlm = ,
        "RACF Reports On-Demand has ended due to a user requested termination."
      Address ISPEXEC
      "SETMSG MSG(RROD000Z)"
      'tbend' ratab
      Exit display_rc
    End
    if zcmd /= null then do
      if abbrev('SETUP',word(zcmd,1)) = 1 then do
        zcmd = null
          'vget (rrjc1 rrjc2 rrjc3 rrjc4) profile'
        jc1 =  rrjc1
        jc2 =  rrjc2
        jc3 =  rrjc3
        jc4 =  rrjc4
        'display panel(racfrods)'
        if rc = 0 then do
          rrjc1 = jc1
          rrjc2 = jc2
          rrjc3 = jc3
          rrjc4 = jc4
          'vput (rrjc1 rrjc2 rrjc3 rrjc4) profile'
        end
      end
      if abbrev('ONLY',word(zcmd,1)) = 1 then
      if word(zcmd,2) /= null then do
        'tbtop' ratab
        'tbskip' ratab
        test = translate(word(zcmd,2))
        do forever
          if pos(test,translate(rec pgm name desc)) = 0 then do
            'tbdelete' ratab
          end
          'tbskip' ratab
          if rc > 0 then do
            rrdsm = 'Filtered.'
            rrdlm = 'Table of reports filtered by' test
            'setmsg msg(rrod000z)'
            leave
          end
        end
      end
      if abbrev('REFRESH',word(zcmd,1)) = 1 then do
        'tbend' ratab
        ratab = racfrodt()
        rrdsm = 'Refreshed.'
        rrdlm = 'Table of available reports refreshed.'
        'setmsg msg(rrod000z)'
      end
    end
    else do

      if row = null then if rsel = 'S' then
      if rec /= 'ALL' then
      do
        doit = 'S'
        'tbmod' ratab
        selected = selected + 1
      end
      if row > 0 then if rsel = 'S' then
      if rec /= 'ALL' then
      do
        'tbtop' ratab
        'tbskip' ratab 'number('row')'
        doit = 'S'
        'tbmod' ratab
        selected = selected + 1
      end
      if rsel = 'S' then
      if rec = 'ALL' then do
        if selected > 0 then do
          rrdsm = 'Error.'
          rrdlm = 'You may not select ALL after having selected' ,
            'individual reports. Perform a Refresh and then' ,
            'you may select ALL.'
          'setmsg msg(rrod000z)'
        end
        else do
          doit = 'S'
          'tbmod' ratab
          leave
        end
      end
    end
    zcmd = null
  end

  "FTOPEN TEMP"
  ftrc = RC
  If ftrc > 0 then
  Do
    rrdsm = "File tailoring RC="ftrc
    rrdlm = ,
      "RACF Reports On-Demand has ended due to a file tailoring FTOPEN error."
    Address ISPEXEC
    "SETMSG MSG(RROD000Z)"
    'tbend' ratab
    Exit ftrc
  End

  Call BUILD_JCL

  'tbend' ratab
  "FTCLOSE"

  "VGET (ZTEMPF)"

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
/*                                                                   */
/* Return codes greater than 4 for the EDIT service are critical.    */
/* Consult the ISPF Services Guide, SC19-3626, for detailed error    */
/* information.                                                      */
/*                                                                   */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */

  "EDIT DATASET('"ZTEMPF"') MACRO(RACFRODN)"
  editrc = RC
  If editrc > 4 then
  Do
    rrdsm = "Edit error RC="editrc
    rrdlm = ,
      "Critical EDIT failure.  Consult ISPF Services Guide for information."
    rrdtyp = "CRITICAL"
    Address ISPEXEC
    "SETMSG MSG(RROD000Z)"
    Exit editrc
  End

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
/*                                                                   */
/* Submit the RACF Reports-On_Demand based upon RSUB = Y             */
/*                                                                   */
/* Specifying END, RETURN, SUBMIT, or EXIT will submit the JCL for   */
/* background JES execution.   CANCEL will terminate the ISPF editor */
/* and any submission to batch of the JCL that was generated by      */
/* ISPF file tailoring.                                              */
/*                                                                   */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */

  if rsub = 'N' then exit 0

  "VGET (ZVERB)"

  If wordpos(zverb,'END RETURN SUBMIT EXIT') > 0
  then
  Do
    Address TSO
    "SUBMIT '"ZTEMPF"'"
    subrc = RC
    Address ISPEXEC
    If subrc = 0 then
    "SETMSG MSG(RROD003)"
    Else
    "SETMSG MSG(RROD005)"
  End
  Else
  Do
    Address ISPEXEC
    "SETMSG MSG(RROD004)"
  End
  Exit RC

/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
/*                                                                   */
/* Build_JCL:  A file tailoring subroutine to build JCL              */
/*                                                                   */
/* A return code greater than 0 indicates a critical error when      */
/* processing (tailoring) a file skeleton.  Consult the ISPF         */
/* Services Guide, SC19-3626, for detailed error information.        */
/*                                                                   */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */

Build_JCL:

  "FTINCL RACFREPT"
  ftrc = RC
  If ftrc > 0 then
  Do
    Address ISPEXEC
    "SETMSG MSG(RROD001)"
    Exit ftrc
  End
  Return ftrc

RACFRODT.text:
/* Rexx Dialog to Dynamically load an ISPF Table of RACF Reports     */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
/*                                                                   */
/* Created, 19Mar20, Lionel B. Dyck                                  */
/* . Dynamically create, load, and return the ISPF Table Name to     */
/*   our caller: e.g. table=racfrodt()                               */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */

/* Trace ?I                                                          */

Address ISPEXEC
"CONTROL ERRORS CANCEL"

 rtab = 'RA'time('s')    /* dynamic table name */
 doit = ''

'tbcreate' rtab 'keys(rec) names(doit name pgm desc) nowrite'

last = sourceline()

hit = 0
do i = 1 to last
   data = sourceline(i)
   if left(data,1) = '>' then do
      hit = 1
      iterate
      end
   if hit = 0 then iterate
   if left(data,1) = '*' then iterate
   parse value data with rec name pgm desc
   'tbadd' rtab
   end

return rtab
/* what follows must remain entirely in a rexx comment and end with
   an */
/*
>Start of RACF Report-on-Demand Report Table Data
*
* comments have * in column 1
*
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  Purpose:  RACFRPTS data file
*  Notes:    1) Reports with a name starting with the characters
*                 @____ and $____ came from 'SYS1.SAMPLIB(IRRICE)'
*                 #____ came from IBM download website (RACFICE2)'
*                 ICE__ came from oocities/Steveneeland/Sort_Reports
*            2) And the rest came from Nico Rizzuto at www.rizzuto.it
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Rec   Name  Program                   Description
* ---- ------ -------- ------------------------------------------------
  ALL  ALL    ICETOOL  Generate all reports
  100  GPBD   ICETOOL  Group basic data
  100A @CPRO  ICETOOL  Number of profiles in the RACF Database
  100B @CUG$  ICETOOL  Universal group count
  100C #LMUG  ICETOOL  List the members of all universal groups
  102  GPMEM  ICETOOL  Group members
  102A @CONN  ICETOOL  Userids with group privileges above use
  120A @GIDS  ICETOOL  USS GIDs used more than once
  200  USBD   ICETOOL  Userids basic data
  200A @NPWI  ICETOOL  Userids with NOINTERVAL specified
  200B @UGLB  ICETOOL  Userids With extraordinary authorities
  200C @UL90  ICETOOL  Userids defined in the past 90 days
  200D @UVRK  ICETOOL  Userids which are currently revoked
  200E ICE50  ICETOOL  Userids who have a 'PASSDATE=00.000'
  200F ICE58  ICETOOL  Userids who have non-expiring passwords
  200G ICE64  ICETOOL  Userids that have never been used
  200H ICE56  ICETOOL  Userids revoked or have a future revoke date set
  200I ICE61  ICETOOL  Userids with UAUDIT flag set to 'ON'
  200J ICE74  ICETOOL  Userids with password interval not 60 days
  205  USCON  ICETOOL  Group connections
  205A @CCON  ICETOOL  Userids with more than 100 group connections
  205B @GRPM  ICETOOL  Members of the SYS1 group
  205C @UGRP  ICETOOL  Userids with extraordinary group authorities
  206A @ASOC  ICETOOL  Userids who have explicit associations defined
  207A @CLBL  ICETOOL  Certificate labels which may need to change
  220  USTSO  ICETOOL  Userids TSO data
  270  USOMVS ICETOOL  Userids USS OMVS data
  270A @OMVS  ICETOOL  Userids with an USS OMVS segment
  270B @SUPU  ICETOOL  USS super users (UID of 0)
  270C @UIDS  ICETOOL  USS UIDs used more than once
  400  DSBD   ICETOOL  Dataset basic data
  400A $CHLQ  ICETOOL  Dataset HLQs with excessive generic profiles
  400B $CFQG  ICETOOL  Dataset HLQs with lots of fully qual. profiles
  400C @UADS  ICETOOL  Dataset profiles with UACCs of other than NONE
  400D @WNDS  ICETOOL  Dataset profiles in WARNING mode
  400E ICE66  ICETOOL  Dataset profiles and their UACC
  400F ICE59  ICETOOL  Dataset profiles with a UACC=NONE
  402A @IDSC  ICETOOL  Dataset cond. access w/ ID(*) of other than NONE
  404  DSACC  ICETOOL  Dataset access
  404A @ALDS  ICETOOL  Userids with ALTER to discrete dataset profiles
  404B @IDSS  ICETOOL  Dataset standard ACLs with ID(*) other than NONE
  404U DSACCG ICETOOL  Dataset access by group
  500  GRBD   ICETOOL  General resource basic data
  500A @BGGR  ICETOOL  Discrete generic profiles with generic names
  500B @CGEN  ICETOOL  Number of general resource profiles
  500C @PCAM  ICETOOL  Program profiles with MAIN or BASIC attributes
  500D @UAGR  ICETOOL  General resources with UACC other than NONE
  500E @WNGR  ICETOOL  General resources in WARNING mode
  503  ICE53  ICETOOL  General resources with dupl. trans. in mbr list
  505  GRACC  ICETOOL  General resource access
  505A @IGRS  ICETOOL  General resource access w/ ID(*) other than NONE
  505U GRACCG ICETOOL  General resource access by group
  507A @IGRC  ICETOOL  General resource access w/ ID(*) other than NONE
  540  GRST   ICETOOL  Started task segment
  560  #CEXP  ICETOOL  Expired or nearly expired certificates
  901  SYSTEM DSMON    System information
  902  RACGRP DSMON    Group tree
  903  SYSPPT DSMON    Program properties table
  904  RACAUT DSMON    Authorized caller table
  905  RACCDT DSMON    Class descriptor table
  906  RACEXT DSMON    Exits
  907  RACGAC DSMON    Global access table
  908  RACSPT DSMON    Started procedure table
  909  RACUSR DSMON    User attributes
  910  SYSLNK DSMON    Link List datasets
  911  SYSAPF DSMON    APF datasets
  912  SYSCAT DSMON    Master and user catalogs
  913  RACDST DSMON    Primary and backup datbases
  914  SYSSDS DSMON    System datasets
  915  USRDSN DSMON    User datasets
*/

STUB.text:
/* --------------------  rexx procedure  -------------------- *
 * Name:      RACFROD                                         *
 *                                                            *
 * Function:  dynamically allocate the RACFROD libraries      *
 *            and then invoke it                              *
 *                                                            *
 * Syntax:    %RACFROD                                        *
 *                                                            *
 * ---------------------------------------------------------- */

 exec   = "'hlq.RACFROD.EXEC'" /* change */
 mlib   = "'hlq.RACFROD.MSGS'" /* change */
 slib   = "'hlq.RACFROD.SKELS'" /* change */
 plib   = "'hlq.RACFROD.PANELS'" /* change */

 'altlib activate dataset('exec') application(exec)'
 address ispexec
 'libdef ispmlib dataset id('mlib') stack'
 'libdef ispslib dataset id('slib') stack'
 'libdef ispplib dataset id('plib') stack'
 'Select cmd(%RACFROD) scrname(RACFROD) newappl(racf)'
 'libdef ispmlib'
 'libdef ispplib'
 'libdef ispslib'
 address tso
 'altlib deactivate application(exec)'
